data.question: What is the purpose of the sulfur-containing nano-capsule-based electrochemical metal–organic framework sensor Co-TMC4R-BDC?
data.answer: The purpose of the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor is for the capture and detection of heavy metal ions (HMIs) in aqueous solutions.

data.question: What are the heavy metal ions that the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor can detect?
data.answer: The Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor can detect Cu2+, Pb2+, Cd2+, and Hg2+.

data.question: How does the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor interact with heavy metal ions for their capture and detection?
data.answer: The Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor interacts with heavy metal ions through the complexation between sulfur atoms and HMIs, as well as cation···π interactions between phenyl rings and HMIs.

data.question: What are the advantages of using the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor for heavy metal ion detection compared to conventional detection techniques?
data.answer: The advantages of using the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor include high sensitivity, operation ease, simultaneous multi-element detection ability, and lower detection limits for certain heavy metals compared to standard ones for drinking water quality.

data.question: What experimental conditions were optimized for the best detection performance of the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor?
data.answer: The optimized experimental conditions include the type of electrolyte, modifier amount, pH value, deposition potential, and deposition time.

data.question: True or False: The Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor can only detect heavy metal ions individually and not simultaneously.
What computational method was used to support the understanding of the interaction between the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor and heavy metal ions?
data.answer: Density functional theory (DFT) calculations were used to support the understanding of the interaction.

data.question: What are the real-world applications tested for the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor?
data.answer: The real-world applications tested include the detection of heavy metal ions in tap water, mineral water, and lake water.

data.question: True or False: The Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor has poor reproducibility and stability for heavy metal ion detection.
What are the key components of the Co-TMC4R-BDC sensor that contribute to its ability to capture and detect heavy metal ions?
data.answer: The key components include the sulfur-containing calix[4]resorcinarene ligand modified with four 4-mercaptopyridines (TMC4R) and 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid (1,4-BDC) with Co(II) cations.
